intro: Hypochaeris maculata, commonly known as the spotted buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with dark brown or black markings, which are typically arranged in a composite flower head. The plant is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and it has been introduced to various parts of the world. Hypochaeris maculata typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. It is an annual or biennial plant that produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind.
